intro: Hemitelia caudipinnula, commonly known as the slender-leafed hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
